intro: Allionia incarnata f. villosiceps, commonly known as the hairy pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its root system is notable for its pinkish color and is often used in traditional herbal medicine. The hairy variant of this species is distinguished by its dense, soft pubescence on the stems and leaves.
